str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Much, many; often.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

word: [He is our father] in the presence of
str2: Opposite, in front (of), over against. From kata and enanti; directly opposite.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To make that which was dead to live, cause to live, quicken. From the same as zoon and poieo; tovitalize.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
